014package org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.transaction;
015
016import org.jdbi.v3.core.transaction.TransactionException;
017import org.jdbi.v3.core.transaction.TransactionIsolationLevel;
018import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.SqlObject;
019
020/**
021 * A mixin interface to expose transaction methods on the sql object.
022 * <p>
023 * Use caution with {@link org.jdbi.v3.core.Jdbi#onDemand(Class) on-demand} {@code Transactional} instances.
024 * {@link org.jdbi.v3.core.Handle} throws {@link TransactionException} if closed while a
025 * transaction is open. Since on-demand extensions open and close a handle around each method invocation, calling
026 * {@link #begin()} on an on-demand {@code Transactional} will always leave a transaction open, and thus
027 * <em>always</em> throw this exception.
028 * <p>
029 * Users of on-demand {@code Transactional} instances should use the {@code inTransaction} and {@code useTransaction}
030 * methods to execute transactions. It is safe to call other {@code Transactional} methods from inside these callbacks.
031 *
032 * @param <This> must match the interface that is extending this one.
033 */
034public interface Transactional<This extends Transactional<This>> extends SqlObject {
035    /**
036     * Begins a transaction.
037     *
038     * @throws TransactionException if called on an on-demand Transactional instance.
039     */
040    default void begin() {
041        getHandle().begin();
042    }
043
044    /**
045     * Commits the open transaction.
046     */
047    default void commit() {
048        getHandle().commit();
049    }
050
051    /**
052     * Rolls back the open transaction.
053     */
054    default void rollback() {
055        getHandle().rollback();
056    }
057
058    /**
059     * Creates a savepoint with the given name on the transaction.
060     *
061     * @param savepointName the savepoint name.
062     */
063    default void savepoint(String savepointName) {
064        getHandle().savepoint(savepointName);
065    }
066
067    /**
068     * Rolls back to the given savepoint.
069     *
070     * @param savepointName the savepoint name.
071     */
072    default void rollbackToSavepoint(String savepointName) {
073        getHandle().rollbackToSavepoint(savepointName);
074    }
075
076    /**
077     * Releases the given savepoint.
078     *
079     * @param savepointName the savepoint name.
080     */
081    default void releaseSavepoint(String savepointName) {
082        getHandle().release(savepointName);
083    }
084
085    /**
086     * Executes the given callback within a transaction, returning the value returned by the callback.
087     *
088     * @param callback the callback to execute
089     * @param <R>      method return type
090     * @param <X>      exception optionally thrown by the callback.
091     * @return the value returned by the callback.
092     * @throws X any exception thrown by the callback.
093     */
094    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
095    default <R, X extends Exception> R inTransaction(TransactionalCallback<R, This, X> callback) throws X {
096        return withHandle(h -> h.inTransaction(txn -> callback.inTransaction((This) this)));
097    }
098
099    /**
100     * Executes the given callback within a transaction, returning the value returned by the callback.
101     *
102     * @param isolation the transaction isolation level.
103     * @param callback  the callback to execute
104     * @param <R>       method return type
105     * @param <X>       exception optionally thrown by the callback.
106     * @return the value returned by the callback.
107     * @throws X any exception thrown by the callback.
108     */
109    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
110    default <R, X extends Exception> R inTransaction(
111            TransactionIsolationLevel isolation, TransactionalCallback<R, This, X> callback) throws X {
112        return withHandle(h -> h.inTransaction(isolation, txn -> callback.inTransaction((This) this)));
113    }
114
115    /**
116     * Executes the given callback within a transaction.
117     *
118     * @param callback the callback to execute
119     * @param <X>      exception optionally thrown by the callback.
120     * @throws X any exception thrown by the callback.
121     */
122    default <X extends Exception> void useTransaction(TransactionalConsumer<This, X> callback) throws X {
123        inTransaction(callback.asCallback());
124    }
125
126    /**
127     * Executes the given callback within a transaction.
128     *
129     * @param isolation the transaction isolation level.
130     * @param callback  the callback to execute
131     * @param <X>       exception optionally thrown by the callback.
132     * @throws X any exception thrown by the callback.
133     */
134    default <X extends Exception> void useTransaction(TransactionIsolationLevel isolation,
135                                                      TransactionalConsumer<This, X> callback) throws X {
136        inTransaction(isolation, callback.asCallback());
137    }
138}
